title: Can you solve the rogue submarine riddle? Difficulty level: Master - Alex Rosenthal

multiple-choice.question: What was the problem the protagonist faced after hacking into the nuclear missile launch override?

options.label: A
options.text: Finding the location of the submarine

multiple-choice.question: What was the condition given by the big boss to Minion A and Minion B regarding the launch codes?

options.label: A
options.text: They were allowed to share the codes with each other

options.label: B
options.text: They were not allowed to share the codes with anyone

options.label: C
options.text: They were forbidden to share the codes with each other

options.label: D
options.text: They were required to share the codes with the big boss

multiple-choice.question: What information did Minion A have about Minion B's number?

options.label: A
options.text: Minion A knew Minion B's number

options.label: B
options.text: Minion A did not know Minion B's number, but knew it was less than 7

options.label: C
options.text: Minion A did not know Minion B's number, but knew it was a prime number

options.label: D
options.text: Minion A did not know Minion B's number, but knew it was a product of two numbers

multiple-choice.question: What was the insight gained from Minion A's first statement?

options.label: A
options.text: Minion B's number could be any positive integer

options.label: B
options.text: Minion B's number must be a prime number or the product of 1 and the square of a prime

options.label: C
options.text: Minion B's number must be less than 7

options.label: D
options.text: Minion B's number must be a sum of two numbers

multiple-choice.question: What were the possible values of Minion A's number based on the analysis?
What was the crucial thing to remember during the analysis?

options.label: A
options.text: Minion B's number was guaranteed to be on Minion A's list

options.label: B
options.text: Minion B's number was not guaranteed to be on Minion A's list

options.label: C
options.text: Minion A's number was guaranteed to be on Minion B's list

options.label: D
options.text: Minion A's number was not guaranteed to be on Minion B's list

multiple-choice.question: If Minion A's number was 5, what could Minion B's number be?
Why was the option of Minion A's number being 6 eliminated?

options.label: A
options.text: Because Minion B would know Minion A's number

options.label: B
options.text: Because Minion B would not know Minion A's number

options.label: C
options.text: Because Minion A would know Minion B's number

options.label: D
options.text: Because Minion A would not know Minion B's number

multiple-choice.question: What was the correct override code?
What was the outcome of the protagonist's actions?

options.label: B
options.text: The missile launch was overridden, but the submarine escaped

options.label: C
options.text: The missile launch was overridden, and the submarine was destroyed

options.label: D
options.text: The protagonist was captured by the agents of chaos

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body?
How did Karen Keegan acquire her second genome?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: B
options.text: From her twin sister who was born

options.label: C
options.text: By absorbing fetal stem cells from her fraternal twin's embryo in utero

multiple-choice.question: What is one possible way for a mother to inherit fetal stem cells from her child?

options.label: B
options.text: Through the flow of nutrients across the placenta

multiple-choice.question: What happened to the mother's liver in one documented case of chimerism?

options.label: A
options.text: It failed and had to be transplanted

options.label: B
options.text: It was damaged due to the presence of fetal stem cells

options.label: C
options.text: It started to regenerate itself using fetal stem cells from a pregnancy almost 20 years earlier

options.label: D
options.text: It remained unaffected by the presence of fetal stem cells

multiple-choice.question: Why didn't Karen Keegan's immune system attack or destroy the cells with the second genome?

options.label: A
options.text: Because her immune system was suppressed during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Because the cells with the second genome were undetectable

options.label: C
options.text: Because her immune system recognized both genomes as her body's own

options.label: D
options.text: Because the cells with the second genome were not present in her body

multiple-choice.question: What is a possible consequence of chimerism in individuals who have two genomes?

options.label: A
options.text: They may have two-toned skin or hair

options.label: B
options.text: They may have a weakened immune system

options.label: C
options.text: They may be more prone to genetic disorders

options.label: D
options.text: They may have a higher risk of cancer

multiple-choice.question: How can chimerism challenge our perception of genetics?

options.label: A
options.text: By showing that genetics is not a fixed trait

options.label: B
options.text: By demonstrating that genetic testing is not always accurate

options.label: C
options.text: By revealing that individuals can have multiple genomes

options.label: D
options.text: By proving that genetics is not a factor in determining identity

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of the father's sperm carried a second genome from an embryonic twin in one documented case?
What is one possible implication of the fact that 1 in 8 individual births started out as twin pregnancies?

options.label: A
options.text: That there may be more cases of chimerism than previously thought

options.label: B
options.text: That genetic testing is not always accurate

options.label: C
options.text: That individuals with chimerism are more prone to genetic disorders

options.label: D
options.text: That chimerism is a rare condition

multiple-choice.question: What is one way that chimerism can occur, apart from absorbing fetal stem cells from a twin in utero?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

title: Earth's mysterious red glow, explained - Zoe Pierrat

multiple-choice.question: What was the unexpected discovery made by researchers in 2009 while scanning the Earth's surface?

options.label: C
options.text: A decrease in carbon dioxide levels

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of chlorophyll in plant cells?
A farmer notices that their crops are not growing as expected. Which method would be most effective in determining the health of the crops?
What is the byproduct of photosynthesis that is essential for life on Earth?
Why do plants transform excess light into heat and dissipate it out of their leaves?
What is the term for the process by which plants radiate excess light back out at a different wavelength?
How does tracking chlorophyll fluorescence from space allow researchers to monitor ecosystem health?

options.label: A
options.text: By measuring the level of greenness

options.label: B
options.text: By detecting changes in plant color

multiple-choice.question: What is the advantage of using chlorophyll fluorescence as a measure of plant health compared to levels of greenness?

options.label: B
options.text: It is more reliable and direct

multiple-choice.question: Scientists have used chlorophyll fluorescence to monitor which of the following environmental phenomena?
What is the potential benefit of monitoring chlorophyll fluorescence for plant health?

options.label: A
options.text: It can help predict plant stress before visible signs appear
